net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets

Class CssIconWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets.AbstractWidget
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets.CssIconWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeWriteId<String>

    public class CssIconWidget
extends AbstractWidget
    This is a Widget for an empty <span> element that is used as placeholder for an icon. Via CSS it can be styled to appear as an icon. This can be done via background-image or web-fonts (font-awesome).
    The icon style is given at construction time but can also be modified for dynamic icons.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
